alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Brown; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 1:33AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Rock, northeastern Brown, northwestern Holt, Keya Paha and Boyd Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 133 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Burke to 15 miles southwest of Herrick to 6 miles northeast of Norden. Movement was southeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bassett, Spencer, Springview, Stuart, Butte, Newport, Naper, Gross, Bristow, Dustin, Burton, Anoka, Nets Peak, Meadville, Hull Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Mariaville, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Mills and Brocksburg. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 176 and 182, and between mile markers 203 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 255 and 286. Highway 281 between mile markers 200 and 223. Highway 12 between mile markers 34 and 132. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boyd; Brown; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock
